definition: regardless of weather conditions/rain, hail or shine
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: He's always working in his garden - come rain or shine .
sentences.chinese: 他总在花园里干活，风雨无阻。

sentences.english: We must struggle against our own laziness and stay with our training, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须跟自己的懒惰做斗争，坚持锻炼，风雨无阻。

sentences.english: But teams play football rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 但玩足球可以风雨无阻。

sentences.english: She worked as a volunteer helping women and children, eight hours a day, six days a week.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个帮助妇女和儿童的志愿者，风雨无阻。

sentences.english: Donating your blood not only shows your affection, but also saves human life under any circumstance, .
sentences.chinese: 无偿献血奉献爱心，拯救生命风雨无阻。

sentences.english: But teams play football rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 可是，美式足球却是风雨无阻的。

sentences.english: The fete will take place on Sunday, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 游园义卖会定于星期日举行，风雨无阻。

sentences.english: Loves on the road, always in all weather, even if is the tear flows out unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 爱在路上，从来就风雨无阻，哪怕是眼泪不断流出。

sentences.english: Above, Huang Te - ho has braved the weather every day to clean the streets, for twenty - eight years.
sentences.chinese: 黄德和每日风雨无阻地清扫街道，廿八年如一日。

definition: to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
not shaken by thunder (idiom); the arrangements are unalterable/to adhere rigidly to regulations/will go ahead whatever happens (of an arrangement or plan)
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
